H0.text: Which part of the body can suffer from cirrhosis. Pancreas

H1.text: Which part of the body can suffer from cirrhosis. Kidneys

H2.text: Which part of the body can suffer from cirrhosis. Lungs

H3.text: Which part of the body can suffer from cirrhosis. Liver

A4.text: Cirrhosis is a chronic condition of the liver in which the normal functioning tissue, or parenchyma, is replaced with scar tissue (fibrosis) and regenerative nodules.

A5.text: Cirrhosis can cause complications such as hepatic encephalopathy, bleeding from dilated veins in the esophagus, stomach, or intestines, and liver cancer.
